roles: chairperson of district in Skåne county
supporting_quotes: She was at one time chairperson of the Moderate Youth League district in that county.
At the Battle of Lycksele, when current party leader Fredrik Reinfeldt was elected chairman of the Youth League, Carlsson was elected vice chairman.
After working as an auditor, Carlsson joined the Moderate Party office in 1994.
In 1995, she was elected to the European Parliament and served until 2002.

organizations: Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs and Industrial Policy
supporting_quotes: In parliament, she served on the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs and Industrial Policy (1995-1999)

organizations: Committee on Foreign Affairs, Human Rights, Common Security and Defence Policy
supporting_quotes: on the Committee on Foreign Affairs, Human Rights, Common Security and Defence Policy (1999-2002)

organizations: European Economic Area Joint Parliamentary Committee
supporting_quotes: she was vice-chair of the parliament's delegation to the European Economic Area Joint Parliamentary Committee (EEA) from 1995 until 1997.
In 1999, she was elected vice chairman of the Moderate Party.
Second Deputy Chairperson of the Moderate Party 1999–2003
In the 2002 national elections, Carlsson was elected to the Riksdag for Stockholm.
Member of the Riksdag In office 30 September 2002 – 5 October 2006
member of the Swedish Riksdag from 2002 to 2013
deputy chairman of her party from 2003 to 2015
First Deputy Chairperson of the Moderate Party 2003–2015
She served as Minister for International Development Cooperation from 2006 to 2013
Minister for International Development Cooperation In office 6 October 2006 – 17 September 2013

organizations: High Level Advisory Council on Women's Economic Empowerment
supporting_quotes: From 2007, Carlsson was a member of the World Bank Group's High Level Advisory Council on Women's Economic Empowerment

organizations: Commission on Climate Change and Development
supporting_quotes: In her capacity as minister, Carlsson also chaired the Stockholm-based Commission on Climate Change and Development (CCCD), a body made up of 13 international experts and established by the Swedish government in 2007

organizations: High-level Panel on Post-2015 Development Agenda
supporting_quotes: In her final year as minister from 2012 until 2013, Carlsson served – alongside Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, David Cameron and others – on the High-level Panel on Post-2015 Development Agenda

organizations: High Level Panel on Fragile States
supporting_quotes: Following her resignation, Carlsson served alongside Tertius Zongo and Callisto Madavo on the African Development Bank's three-member High Level Panel on Fragile States between 2013 and 2014
Between 2013 and 2015, she was a member of the UNAIDS–Lancet Commission on Defeating AIDS

supporting_quotes: In 2017, United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres appointed Carlsson as the UNAIDS deputy executive director, management and governance, and Assistant Secretary-General of the United Nation.

supporting_quotes: Africa Europe Foundation (AEF), Member of the High-Level Group of Personalities on Africa-Europe Relations (since 2020), co-chair of the Strategy Group on Health

On 29 June 2023, the Government of Sweden appointed Carlsson as the new Chair of the Governing Board of the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (SIDA). She formally took up the position on 1 July 2023.
